incident_updates.body:
From 17:39-18:12 UTC GitHub was down in parts of North America, particularly the US East coast, and South America. 

GitHub takes measures to ensure that we have redundancy in our system for various disaster scenarios. We have been working on building redundancy to an earlier single point of failure in our network architecture at a second Internet edge facility. This second Internet edge facility was completed in January and has been actively routing production traffic since then. Today we were performing a live failover test to validate that we could in fact use this second Internet edge facility if the primary were to fail. Unfortunately, during this failover we inadvertently caused a production outage.

During the test we exposed that the secondary site had a network pathing configuration issue that prevented it from properly functioning as the primary facility. This caused issues with Internet connectivity to GitHub, ultimately resulting in an outage. We were immediately notified of the issue in our monitoring and alerting. Within two minutes of being alerted we reverted the change and brought the primary facility back online. Once online it took time for traffic to be rebalanced and for our border routers to reconverge restoring public connectivity to affected GitHub systems.

This failover test helped expose the configuration issue, and we are addressing the gaps in both configuration and our failover testing which will help make GitHub more resilient. We recognize the severity of this outage and apologize for the impact it has to our customers.
We have recovered and are operating normally
The root cause has been mitigated and most services have fully recovered. We are still monitoring for full recovery.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to see recovery and are continuing to monitor as recovery continues.
We are starting to see recovery and are continuing to monitor as we mitigate.
We have identified the root cause of the outage and are working toward mitigation
We are currently experiencing an outage of GitHub products and are investigating.

incidents.name: Incident with Actions, API Requests, Codespaces, Git Operations, Pages and Pull Requests

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
API Requests is operating normally.
GitHub App token creation and write load has recovered. Actions, Codespaces, and Pull Requests are within SLOs again. Suspended Apps are being re-enabled while we monitor the recovery.
Token creation for GitHub Apps is failing in 11% of requests due to high write load, impacting core GitHub.com operations. High-traffic Apps are being temporarily disabled to aid system recovery.
We are continuing to investigate ongoing issues with delayed Actions runs, Codespace connections, and PR creation. We are performing a series of steps to mitigate the impact.
We are continuing to investigate ongoing issues with delayed Actions runs, Codespace connections, and PR creation. We are working on mitigating the impact on the core components of our platform.
We are continuing to investigate ongoing issues with delayed Actions runs, Codespace connections, and PR creation. We will provide a more detailed status update within an hour.
Git Operations is operating normally.
We are continuing to investigate issues with Actions queue delays, PR write times, and Codespaces start/resume. GitHub Enterprise Importer customers will also see a delay in migration starts.
Actions customers may see an increase in delayed runs, and some customers may see issues creating PRs and starting or resuming Codespaces. We continue to investigate and drive towards a mitigation.
Actions customers will see an increase in delays when queueing runs as we continue to mitigate the ongoing issue.
Pull Requests is experiencing degraded performance. We are continuing to investigate.
Git Operations is experiencing degraded performance. We are continuing to investigate.
For Actions we are seeing issues for a subset of customers triggering workflow runs and scheduled runs. Workflows using the GITHUB_TOKEN environment variable are also encountering issues.
A subset of Codespaces customers are seeing failures when creating or starting Codespaces.
We are continuing to investigate the underlying issue which is causing impact.
API Requests is experiencing degraded performance. We are still investigating and will provide an update when we have one.
We are investigating issues which are impacting Codespaces, Actions and GitHub Apps which use server-to-server tokens. We are working towards mitigation and will update as we know more.
Pages is experiencing degraded performance. We are continuing to investigate.
Codespaces is experiencing degraded performance. We are still investigating and will provide an update when we have one.
We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Actions.

We are actively investigating an issue causing fewer than 1% of workflow runs on GitHub-hosted runners to fail.
We are actively investigating an issue causing fewer than 1% of Copilot code suggestions to time out.
Actions is experiencing degraded performance. We are still investigating and will provide an update when we have one.
We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Copilot.

incidents.name: Incident with Actions, Codespaces and Pages

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Codespaces is operating normally.
We are still working towards full recovery. Actions jobs still experience delays when being queued.
Pages is operating normally.
We are still working towards full recovery. Actions jobs still experience delays when being queued.
Codespaces is experiencing degraded performance. We are continuing to investigate.
Actions workflows have started running again. We're continuing to work towards full recovery.
Actions is now experiencing degraded performance. We are still investigating and will provide an update when we have one.
We are seeing signs of recovery for Actions and continue to monitor closely. We will continue to post updates about progress as soon as we have them.
We continue to work on mitigating the problems with Actions and Pages with high urgency. We will continue to post updates about our progress.
Pages is experiencing degraded performance. We are continuing to investigate.
We are still investigating the cause of Actions degradation, we will provide an update when we have one.
Actions is now experiencing degraded availability. We are still investigating and will provide an update when we have one.
We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Actions.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've applied a mitigation to fix the issues with queuing and running Actions jobs. We are seeing improvements in telemetry and are monitoring for full recovery.
The team continues to investigate issues with some Actions jobs being queued for a long time and a percentage of jobs failing. We will continue to keep users updated on progress towards mitigation.
We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Actions.
